DataElement.preferredName: Genomic Medicine Implementation Participation Checklist Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medical discipline that uses genomic information about an individual as part of their clinical care (e.g. for diagnostic or therapeutic decision-making) and for the health outcomes and policy implications of that clinical use. (NIH/NHGRI)_The act of carrying into effect._The act of taking part in an activity._A list of items required or things to be done or considered.__a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: The adoption dimension of RE-
ReferenceDocuments.description: The adoption dimension of RE-AIM includes a four-item checklist used to evaluate the characteristics of settings that participate in offering genetic services or a new genetic services intervention.

DataElement.origin: RE-AIM:Reach Effectiveness Adoption Implementation and Maintenance (RE-AIM)
